page.title: 18Tithe Barn, South Littleton.
page.content: Tithe Barn is in the Littletons.It used to belong to Evesham Abbey.It was thought that John Ombersley an abbot of Evesham had it built between thirteen hundred and sixty seven and seventy nine,but some scientists took samples of the timber and believed that it had been built earlier.The nearest dates are between twelve hundred and fifty and thirteen hundred.It was used for storing the { {tithe}which was ten per cent of everybody's crop.It changed ownership when {Henry VIII}pulled down Evesham Abbey.The walls are built of blue lias limestone and cotswold marlstone.The roof is slated and the timbers are oak.It is a raised base {cruck}barn.It has been taken over by the {National {Trust}because it was damaged and the owner could not afford to repair it.Today it stores cattle food.
